result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamie Michael Hay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jamie Michael Hay

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: *Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
*Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*DNA sample; pay the surcharge.  Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
*Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

*NO firearms; weapons.
*Due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

*No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
*NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
*Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.

*Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
*Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
*Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: *This time is stayed pending a review on 2/26/16.

records.addlTxt: Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.

Defendant Jamie Michael Hay in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 17 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 15 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 2/26/16.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-DNA sample; pay the surcharge.  Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Work as able.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Jamie Michael Hay in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Jamie Michael Hay in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  State is ready to proceed.  Jury trial waiver filed.    Court finds upon questioning the defendant freely, voluntarily and knowingly waived right to have a jury trial.  Court is currently in trial and ordered this matter adjourned.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Court trial scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
